h1: How Many Calories in a Rice Bowl?
assumptions: Plain cooked white rice, 1 standard bowl ≈ 200 g (about 1.5 cups); no added oil, salt, or toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by rice type, portion size, cooking method, and additions like sauces or proteins. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard 200 g rice bowl has ~260 kcal and ~5 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a plain rice bowl?
faqs.a: About 260 kcal for a 200 g serving of cooked white rice.

faqs.q: What's the carb content in a rice bowl?
faqs.a: Roughly 56 g carbs, mostly starch, with minimal fiber (0.8 g).

faqs.q: Does rice type affect calories in rice bowl?
faqs.a: Yes—brown rice adds ~10 kcal per 200 g due to higher fiber.

faqs.q: Are there fats or cholesterol in rice bowl?
faqs.a: Plain rice has negligible fat (0.6 g) and 0 mg cholesterol.

faqs.q: How to lower calories in rice bowl?
faqs.a: Use smaller portions, opt for cauliflower rice, or add veggies instead of extras.
